document.docAuthor: Liu, Zhen, He, Jun-Hua, Chen, Xue-Xin & Gupta, Ankita
document.masterDocTitle: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The ater-group of the genus Apanteles Foerster (Hymenoptera, Braconidae, Microgastrinae) from China with the descriptions of forty-eight new species

bibRefCitation.author: Nixon, G. E. J.
bibRefCitation.refString: Nixon, G. E. J. (1965) A reclassification of the tribe Microgasterini (Hymenoptera: Braconidae). Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History), Entomology Series, Supplement 2, 1 - 284.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Apanteles saravus Nixon, 1965: 81
. Type in the U.S. National Museum.
Shenefelt, 1972: 623
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Pterostigma pale brownish yellow with weak darker border; edge of vannal lobe beyond its widest point with at most a few hardly visible, slightly projecting setae; legs obscure brownish throughout; face smooth, shiny, and impunctate; notaulic course behind with striate-punctations; areola sharply defined; metacarp fully 6.0 as long as its distance from apex of marginal cell; inner spur of hind tibia hardly longer than outer spur; ovipositor sheath about as long as hind tibia, setae long, upright; wings markedly brownish with brown setae; hind wing narrow, with second submarginal cell somewhat elongate; spines along upper surface of hind tibia thick and sparse.

Material examined. 1♀ ,

Distribution. China ( Fujian , Guangdong , Guangxi , Guizhou , Hainan , Hunan , Yunnan , Zhejiang ) new record ; Philippines , Vietnam .
Remarks . Characters of the examined specimens mostly agree with the published descriptions, except for the second submarginal cell much longer and face with shallow punctures.
